headline.main: RURAL ECONOMY.; Gleanings of Fact and Practice in Fruit Culture. Pruning.

docs.lead_paragraph: GENERAL REMARKS-OBJECT OF THE OPERATION, operation of pruning is one of the most important that engages the attention of the fruit-grower. It consists in depriving a plant or tree of a portion of its branches, buds, leaves, bark, or roots, in order to produce certain effects on that part which remains.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. frigate Congress, commanded by GEO. F. PEARSON, and bearing the broad penant of Commodore ISAAC MCKEEVER, arrived yesterday morning from Rio Janciro, which port she left June 12. She had been absent three years and three months, and has been the flag-ship of the Brazilian squadron during the whole of that time.

headline.main: THE SOUTH.; Letters on the Productions, Industry and Resources of the Southern States, NUMBER THIRTY

docs.lead_paragraph: Visit to a Rice Plantation continued- Women at Fieldwork-Gangs-Old and Young-Tasks-Drivers-Overseers--Punishment. In my last letter I described to you a part of what I saw in a tour through a large Rice Plantation. I now continue the account. Leaving the rice-land, we went next to some of the upland fields, where we found several other gangs of negroes at work; one entirely of men engaged in ditching;

byline.original: SPECIAL CORRESPONDENCE OF THE N. Y. DAILY TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: It must needs be owned that a bird's eye view of New York discloses, here and there, places not at all sightly, even in the eye of a bird. Between Centre-street and the Bowery there are such. The West side enjoys them at the lower extreme of Greenwich-street, and along Washington-street, and in the vicinity of West Broadway.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Theological Seminary at Columbia, S. C., is prosperous. It has 32 students, $106,000 invested funds, with more subscriptions to come inhas laid the foundations of a new building-numbers 5,000 volumes in its library, and gathers in its list not less than 174 alumni; of whom, however, 15 are dead.

docs.lead_paragraph: On the twelfth of April, 1853, Hon. WASHINGTON HUNT, Mr. HORACE GREELEY, and twenty-two other stalwart, well-tried, honest friends of the People, were constituted by the Legislature a body corporate, under the name of "The People's College," for the purpose of promoting Literature, Science, Arts, and Agriculture.

headline.main: THE CATSKILLS; Going to Catskill Falls for Recreation.

docs.lead_paragraph: How long have I been out of the workingday world? Away from the thronged sidewalks of dusty, dearly-loved New-York? Certain recollections have I of a clay of explosive uproar, militiaparadings, fifes villainously squeaking, unjustifiablycastigated drums ; of the popping, whizzings and bangings of pyrotecnically-patriotic juveniles,-all clearly indicating the Fourth.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New- York Daily Times

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE FRANKLIN. The Russian Invasion of Turkey. MANIFESTO OF THE CZAR. The Markets, &c. &c. RUSSIA AND TURKEY. Public Sentiment in Europe concerning the Russian Invasion. THE ENGLISH PRESS. The French Press Representing the Government. ENGLAND. FRANCE. SPAIN. ITALY. HOLLAND. GERMANY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamship Franklin, CaptWOTTON, arrived at this port, at 5 o'clock yesterday morning. The Franklin sailed from Cowes at 6 A. M., on the 7th inst., having been detained there from 10 o'clock, the night before, by a dense fog. She brings about 90 passengers and over 800 tons valuable French and Swiss goods--valued at over two and a half millions.
